Articles.Content:
I have an idea about integrating telescopes in ksp, to scout stars and other planets hundreds of light years away  these planets not supposed to be an real physical bodies (you never can interact with them) just replicas of real star/planet systems, the purpose to be scouted by telescopes. by watching them u can get some info about them. some of them just space rocks others really interesting glass rain planets

Edited February 6, 2016 by Skylar'
That would be cool. You could earn science by finding them. You could get better pictures with better telescopes.

2 hours ago, worir4 said:

That would be cool. You could earn science by finding them. You could get better pictures with better telescopes. 

Yes, that sounds cool.

I think CactEye telescopes does that.

5 hours ago, Skylar' said:

I have an idea about integrating telescopes in ksp, to scout stars and other planets hundreds of light years away  these planets not supposed to be an real physical bodies (you never can interact with them) just replicas of real star/planet systems, the purpose to be scouted by telescopes. by watching them u can get some info about them. some of them just space rocks others really interesting glass rain planets

See this page for all your science telescope wants and desires.
If this is implemented, Earth's solar system should be one of the discoverable ones.
It's been suggested in the last thread of the month, but have a like anyway.

@Delta_8930 @Kerbin vonKerbal @DMSP

Big thanks to u guys, these mods almost just that what i need can't wait to try them

still it will be quite good to see them in original game
I thought they were already planning something similar for 1.1? If they aren't, they should.

That's a neat idea. Basic telescopes at the Space Center; ability to put better telescopes in orbit to avoid atmospheric blurring; plenty of stock solar systems to "discover" including our own, other realistic ones, and various amusing subtle references to fictional ones. (This solar system has only one planet, a gas giant. Orbiting the gas giant is a large moon that appears to be forested. Orbiting that moon is a smaller moon--wait, that's no moon...)
A sol Easter egg would be really cool

Guys, don't forget about nebulas, galaxies and other interstellar objects. There could be (at least) two types of space telescopes. One Hubble-like to observe gas clouds and galaxies and the other one (Keppler-like) to observe planets. And maybe a big one that would resemble James Webb Space Telescope, which would be an upgrade of both. That's what JWST is meant to do, right? Search for planets and look at bigger things?

EDIT: Have this neat animation of a pulsar seen by Hubble

(at least I think it's from Hubble)

Edited February 7, 2016 by Veeltch

Space stations never had enough potentioal. More orbital science-stuffs would help them, but than even more science could be yielded from other planets. Having something science-stuff for stations that only needs to be in space, not elsewhere, would be quite good in this aspect.

This could also apply to bodies *within* the kerbol system. Like their tracks don't show up in the tracking station until they are "discovered", and only rudimentary info is provided about them. Further discoveries from additional missions would puzzle together more info about them as the game progresses.

 Plus... "orbital telescopes" anyone?

Best,
-Slashy

On 2/7/2016 at 7:48 PM, GoSlash27 said:

 

 Plus... "orbital telescopes" anyone?

 

Is that something from SW? Had to google that but still no clue what it is.

veeltch,

 I'm talking about integrating orbital telescopes like Hubble, Kepler, etc. into KSP for science and expanding the in- game database.

Best,
-Slashy

On 6-2-2016 at 6:49 PM, Veeltch said:

It's been suggested in the last thread of the month, but have a like anyway.

For reference: here it is: 

In my humble opinion, it would be a great addition to add this piece of space exploration to the game, seeing as it has come up independently twice in a short amount of time.
